Method Detail

createBody

PhysicsBody createBody(PhysicsBodyDefinition definition,
                       Collidable collidable,
                       com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 position)
Creates a PhysicsBody from the body definition, placing it at the specified position. Do not place objects at the same place (e.g. origin) and move them later, as bad performance will follow.

The body definitions position will be set to the position. Note that while the object is manipulated, its other properties can be re-used for performance reasons. The position is explicitly set here to make sure unexpected behavior will not follow from this issue.

Parameters:
definition - the body mold to use for creating the body.
collidable - the element that will be called when collision detection occurs.
position - the initial position of the body in world coordinates. See notice above!

removeBody

void removeBody(PhysicsBody body)
Removes the specified body from the world. Is only allowed to be called once on each body

Parameters:
body - The body to be removed from the world.

update

void update(float deltaTime)
Updates the physics simulation (the simulation is time-step based). This should be called once every frame. (Callers should have to worry about using a fixed time step, it is required to be handled internally by the implementation, so that behavior is consistent between runs.)

Parameters:
deltaTime - the time in seconds since last call.

setViewport

void setViewport(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 viewportPosition,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 viewportDimension)
Set the viewport for the physics world (must be set for viewport intersection detection).

Parameters:
viewportPosition - the center-position i world coordinates for the viewport.
viewportDimension - the dimensions of the viewport in world coordinates (width, height).

attachMovementPattern

void attachMovementPattern(PhysicsMovementPattern pattern,
                           PhysicsBody body)
Attaches a movement pattern to the specified body. NOTE only one movement pattern can be attached to a body at a time. I.E. this removes any existing movement patterns attached to the specified body.

Parameters:
pattern - the attach
body - to attach to

detachMovementPattern

void detachMovementPattern(PhysicsBody body)
Detaches the movement pattern from the specified body.

Parameters:
body - The body that should have its movement pattern removed.

getMovementPattern

PhysicsMovementPattern getMovementPattern(PhysicsBody body)
Returns the currently attached movement pattern for the specified body

Parameters:
body - The body whose movement pattern should be checked
Returns:
The currently attached movement pattern

getTimer

Timer getTimer()
Returns a new timer

Returns:
timer

removeTimer

void removeTimer(Timer timer)
Removes a timer from the list of timers.

Parameters:
timer - the timer instance to be removed

runLater

void runLater(java.lang.Runnable task)
Runs a task at the next update.

This method could for example be used to schedule physics altering operation to after a physics world update has been completed.

Parameters:
task - The Runnable that should be run.

getWorld

com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.World getWorld()
Returns the box2d world instance currently running the game. To be handled with care

Returns:
world
